summary: This is a chain of emails from September 21, 2007, discussing the finalization of a plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein. The emails involve attorneys, including Lilly Ann Sanchez, and reference an outstanding issue and the need for a decision from someone referred to as 'MI'. The tone suggests urgency to resolve the matter.

persons.name: Lilly Ann Sanchez
persons.context: Attorney from Fowler White Burnett P.A. who is seeking to finalize Jeffrey Epstein's plea deal and mentions an outstanding issue requiring resolution from 'MI'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the plea deal negotiations discussed in the email chain.

connections.description: Sanchez is an attorney working to finalize a plea deal for Epstein, indicating a legal representation relationship.

events.title: Plea Deal Negotiations
events.description: Email correspondence indicates ongoing negotiations to finalize a plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein, with one issue outstanding.

locations: Espirito Santo Plaza, 14th Floor, 1395 Brickell Avenue, Miami, Florida 33131-3302
keyFacts: On September 21, 2007, attorney Lilly Ann Sanchez was urgently working to finalize a plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein.
The email indicates only one issue was outstanding in the plea negotiations, and Sanchez believed 'MI' had not read all defense submissions relevant to that issue.
The correspondence suggests a chain of command in the case was nearly complete, with Sanchez stating the recipient was 'the only one left'.
